address.streetAddress: 1315 E Jefferson St Between 13th and 14th Avenues
2726 E Cherry St Corner of MLK way and E Cherry St
102 Cherry St Take stairs on sidewalk down to ticket office

itemListElement.name: Seattle Premium Distillery Tour Including 3 Tasting Flights & Snacks

name: Seattle Premium Distillery Tour Including 3 Tasting Flights & Snacks
description: Join us for Seattle's premium distillery tour and tasting experience!  On this small-group tour, limited to just 10 people, you will visit 3 of the premiere distilleries in Seattle and Woodinville that are innovating uniquely Pacific Northwest distilled spirits.  At each stop on this tour, you will enjoy 4 half-ounce. pours of the best distilled spirits that the region has to offer.  You'll learn what you're drinking from the distillers, have a chance to go behind the curtain, and see how these spirits and amazing flavors are made.  Sometimes, we get a chance to try extremely rare single barrel products that are only available locally.  We provide a complimentary gourmet snack platter with artisan cheeses, biscuits and finger food.  You'll travel from point to point in a comfortable high-roof, extended length van with your guide and designated driver at the wheel.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Hard Cider Tour Including 3 Tasting Flights & Snacks

name: Seattle Hard Cider Tour Including 3 Tasting Flights & Snacks
description: Join us on Seattle's original craft hard cider tasting circuit!  On this small-group tour limited to 10 people, you will visit 3 Seattle area locales that are dedicated to the art of brewing up America's original hard beverage, cider!  At each stop on the tour, you will enjoy 3 to 5 4oz. pours each of hard cider.  You'll learn what you're drinking from the cider makers, and you'll gain insight into the hard cider making process.  You'll travel from point to point in a comfortable high-roof, extended length van with your guide and designated driver at the wheel.

review.name: The best thing I did in Seattle!
review.reviewBody: Can you say awesomeness overload?  From being picked up at our location to being escorted to three different cider houses to being dropped off with a smile and a full liver, I would do this tour in a heart beat and WILL do this next time I am back in Seattle.  Even if it goes to the same places. Loved meeting fellow cider lovers and even if you are not a cider lover, you will enjoy this tour.  The varieties of tastings will make elevate and widen your knowledge of ciders.

itemListElement.name: Washington Tulip Festival & Deception Pass Hike Small Group Tour

name: Washington Tulip Festival & Deception Pass Hike Small Group Tour
description:
As a proud official sponsor of the Skagit Valley Tulip Festival, we are excited to bring you this full day, small group tour of two great Northwest Washington highlights: a half day at the Tulip Festival and a hike through Deception Pass, Washington's most popular state park.  Our tour includes a morning at the world famous Tulip Festival, a stop in gorgeous seaside La Conner at midday for lunch, and an afternoon hike through dramatic Deception Pass State Park.   

Throughout the month of April, the Skagit Valley celebrates the coming of spring with the annual Tulip Festival, a regional tradition of the last 35 years.  Deception Pass is situated between Whidbey and Fidalgo Islands, boasts stunning seaside views, dense forests hugged up against cliffs plunging into the water below and mesmerizing tides that flow and churn like a river between the islands.

name: Seattle Puzzling Adventure
description: Turn Seattle into a game while partaking on a 2-hour Walking Adventure. Your smartphone will act as your guide, while you solve clues and complete challenges around the city. Entry price is per team.

itemListElement.name: Skagit Valley Tulip Festival Tour with Local Wine & Cheese from Seattle

name: Skagit Valley Tulip Festival Tour with Local Wine & Cheese from Seattle
description:
With a knowledgeable local guide and driver, enjoy stress-free door-to-door transportation from Seattle. Learn about the region's tulip production history as we escape the city, with snow-capped mountains coming into view on clear days. Skip-the-lines to access the Skagit Valley Tulip Festival's magnificent fields at Roozengaarde and Tulip Town, avoiding the crowds. Visit La Conner, a charming seaside town where we'll stop for lunch. Before returning to Seattle, visit a local winery where you'll enjoy a complimentary glass of award-winning wine accompanied by a selection of organic cheese, bread and snacks. 

-Door-to-door transport with a local guide from all downtown Seattle hotels.
-Guaranteed small group tour limited to 12 guests max. 
-Skip-the-lines at Roozengaarde and Tulip Town fields.
-Explore La Conner, a charming seaside town for lunch stop.
-Visit a local award-winning winery.

Enjoy complimentary glass of wine with local organic cheese, bread, and snacks.

review.name: Disappointed
review.reviewBody: I can't begin to say how disappointed we all were.  We had all been looking forward to this and it was a bust.  Virginia has 300 wineries.  They had FOUR!  I maybe telling my age but I have seen better tasting in the early 70's in an appartment.

review.name: Piece of Noordoostpolder in PNW
review.reviewBody: I live in downtown seattle and decided to do something during pandemic since the US border is close. Michael made sure nobody feels left out from the group. He gave great suggestions on where to eat while we are at La Conner. Got some nifty stuff from Nasty Jack’s Antique store. Spectacular views of tulip fields with Mt. Baker on the background. I recommend to also do the Olympic and Mt. Rainier national parks tour because Michael drives safe and great tour guide.

review.name: VIP treatment
review.reviewBody:
A perfect day! Took us to the front entrance at every stop. Flowers were stunning, weather was perfect, and the wine was a treat too!  A well planned tour with no worries, just a fun filled day. 
We would definitely go on another tour with Nature Nuts.

review.name: SKAGIT TULIP FESTIVAL
review.reviewBody: It was a perfect day with Nature Nuts picking us up at Seattle hotel in van, good company for the ride to 1st tulip farm and enough time to peruse the grounds/tulips, back to van for ride to La Connor, which is a charming town for lunch, shopping, walking.  short ride to 2nd expansive tulip farm with a navigable smaller garden and larger vast field to explore.  The final tour stop was at a winery for a glass and nosh and conversations, then the drive back to Seattle.  Did I say it was a perfect day?  It was.

review.name: Awesome, great experience, thanks Michael.
review.reviewBody:
Michael thank you so much for such an amazing experience. I have loved tulips since I was a little girl and this was no difference.
From the hotel pick-up to the 2 tulip farms we went to then a nice visit to a little town called le conner then end the day with some cheese and wine, this is indeed a perfect tour. 

We did the tour last week of April and there were still plenty of tulips out and I mean there's still fields and fields of tulips. 

Michael was an amazing tour guide as well. Our group was pretty cool group.

Here are some of my recommendations: please wear rain boots that was you'll enjoy the tour. It was very muddy and Michael made sure to tell us to wear rain boots. I highly recommend purchasing one for your seattle trip especially in April. Bundle up, it will get pretty cold. Highly recommend getting gloves.

Again, I highly recommend this tour, for the price point you will not regret it. I will definitely be back next year with my mom.

review.name: A wonderful experience
review.reviewBody: This tour is hands down one of the best experiences you can have when visiting Seattle. It was breathtaking to see all the tulips and their different colors. There's two important things that will make you have a wonderful experience. Please take the weather seriously. Wear the appropriate clothing and footwear when going. If it has rained or is raining, there will be a lot of mud to walk through to get a better view of the tulips. The second thing is to make sure to follow the instructions of your guide. Our guide, Michael was so friendly and accommodating throughout the trip. They make sure you have plenty of time for everything, just make sure to get back to your rendezvous spots so the tour can continue on in a timely manner. It's a tour you should experience at least once in your life.

review.name: Perfect Day in the Tulip Fields
review.reviewBody: All aspects of this tour were excellent. Pick-up/drop-off was on time and easy to find. Michael does a great job of helping different groups get to know one another during the ride and also has a wealth of knowledge about the Skagit Valley. There was plenty of time at both Tulip Town and Roozengaarde to tour the fields on your own, and again, Michael does a wonderful job of explaining all of the features of each location before giving time to explore on your own. Surprisingly beautiful weather made the lunch stop in La Conner and our wines tasting even better. I was extremely pleased with my experience and have already recommended them to friends visiting the area soon. I definitely plan to tour with Nature Nuts again the next time I am in the Seattle area.

review.name: Excellent guide and itinerary
review.reviewBody: Michael is very knowledgeable and shared a lot of interesting tidbits along the way. COVID precautions were all followed and the end of the trip at the winery capped a great tour. Would highly recommend.

review.name: Great Tour!
review.reviewBody: We truly enjoyed out tulip tour with Michael.  He was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable.  We will definitely use his company again!  The wine and cheese tasting was a great ending to a fun day!

review.name: Almost too many Tulips!
review.reviewBody: We were denied access to tulips in 2020 thanx to COVID & so as a backup adventure, we traveled to Washington State to see the Skagit Valley Tulips.  We traveled with Nature Nuts Adventure Travel, and it was one of the best choices we could have made.  Michael with Nature Nuts was an excellent communicator and shared intel for the day in advance & set expectations of the adventure.  Michael arrived on time and was very personable and inviting.  We had a drive up I-5, which was expressed that it would be lack luster, to which it was.  First stop was tulip town, which was only accepting prepaid invites & was sold out for the day.  Tulip town was nice, well set up, but seemed rather small.  The tour was a free form which allowed us to venture forth into the fields and have our own experience with tons of photos taken.  After the tulip town, we were off to La Connor for lunch.  The town is small, but inviting & Michael had us there ahead of the rush which afforded us enough time to get some food without pressure to rush rush rush.  While eating, we were lucky enough see a Harbor Seal pop its head up from the channel and say “hello.”  After lunch we were back on the transit and off to Roozengaarde Display Garden; which was massive and amazing!  Want to talk about information overload; the site was laid out with a smaller version of a garden with many (almost too many) tulips and designs.  The fields went on forever with a mountain backdrop that gave us some incredible views and experiences.  After Roozengaarde Display Garden, we were off to Tulip Valley Winery.  A small little stop where fantastic snacks made locally & of course wine & cider.  I tried the cider, and it was enjoyable, but the snacks (for us ) were the hidden gem, meats & cheeses as well as a pepper jam that my wife fell in love with, and we picked up a few jars to share with our friends.  Lastly, we were back on the I-5 and dropped off punctually.  Michael was outstanding & to me; filled any gaps that might be experienced on the tour.  My wife asked me why I booked the tour versus doing it myself.  Watching all the traffic, clusters of people that had no clue where to go what to do & unawareness of the site selling out; made me even more thankful for Michael, his wisdom & knowledge of the area and mad skills of patient driving made it totally worth it!

itemListElement.name: 14 Passenger Private Transport: Seattle and Long Distance

name: 14 Passenger Private Transport: Seattle and Long Distance
description: Make the best of your next small group outing in Seattle by arranging for private charter transportation.  We specialize in transport for groups of up to 14 people.  Don't let the words "charter" or "private" mislead you.  We believe you'll find our services delightfully affordable compared to other options out there.  We offer several options between Sea-Tac, the Cruise Terminals, the Greater Seattle metro area, as well as long-distance transfers to Vancouver, BC or Portland, OR.  Standard 4 hour or 8 hour private charter service can start and end anywhere within the Greater Seattle Metro area and include unlimited stops and unlimited mileage.

itemListElement.name: Olympic National Park Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch

name: Olympic National Park Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch
description: Witness stunning mountain vistas, pristine alpine meadows, and dense old growth forests on this small group day tour to Olympic National Park. We'll start the day with a beautiful ferry ride from Seattle followed by a scenic drive to this UNESCO World Heritage Site, where we'll explore one of the best-preserved natural landscapes in the world. Throughout the day, you'll enjoy meaningful commentary on the history, culture, and geology of the region from an expert local guide. The tour includes a gourmet lunch, park admission, and pick-up/drop-off at your Seattle hotel in our luxury Mercedes van.

review.name: Attention to Detail
review.reviewBody: Daniel is a great guide and host. He's very knowledgeable and passionate about the park. Hurricane Ridge and Crescent Lake are great destinations. Don't miss the short hikes at each location. You get great views on the Ridge on the hike and you can experience an old growth forest at the Lake walk. Daniel also prepared a wonderful lunch with real silverware and cloth napkins. Don't miss this great tour!

review.name: awesome
review.reviewBody: my favorite part was the picnic The outdoor setting eating among the giant trees was awesome. We had a tablecloth silverware not plastic and a gourmet meal with wine to boot

review.name: Ein wunderschöner und Interessanter Tag, Danke Daniel
review.reviewBody:
Lieber Daniel, das war wirklich ein ganz tolles Erlebnis. Vielen Dank
Wir wurden morgensum 7.00 Uhr in der City mit einem gemütlichen Van abgeholt. Wir waren später mit Dem Guide (Daniel) 7 Personen, eine wirklich nette Truppe.
Wir fuhren zur Fähre, Da gab es dann erstmal Kaffee, Tee oder was das Herz begehrte und ein paar Snacks zum Frühstück. Mit der Fähre rüber nach Bainbridge Island, dann einige Zeit fahren, dann ein kurzer Abstecher in ein Reservat, Daniel hat sehr verständlich und deutlich alles erklärt.
Weiter zu einem Fluss, Wasserfall, Mega See und dann erstmal Mittagessen. Picknick, Daniel hat gekocht und ein mega Mittagessen gezaubert, das war wirklich super lecker. Dann weiter zu einem Wald mit Wasserfall und dann noch zur längsten Sandbank der Welt. Ein wirklich schönes Abenteuer, mit einem super netten Guide. Daniel wusste sehr gut über die ganze Gegend bescheid, und sehr interessante Geschichten zu allem parat gehabt. Wir fühlten uns sehr gut unterhalten und haben eine Menge dazugelernt. Gegen 18.30 Uhr wurden je nach Wunsch in der City wieder abgesetzt.
Wir können diesen Ausflug nur wärmstens empfehlen, auch für Menschen, die aus der Region stammen und gerne etwas mehr über ihre Umgebung wissen und lernen möchten.
Vielen Dank Daniel

review.name: Perfect way to tour Olympic National Park
review.reviewBody: Our day touring with Daniel was beyond wonderful! Daniel is such a great tour guide - well informed and knowledgeable. He has thought of everything - felt like we were spending the day with a friend. Lunch was delicious and it was easy to see that he took great care in providing delicious food & beverages. We loved that our tour maximum was 7. We definitely recommend going with Yonder Sky not only for Olympic National Park, but also for Mt. Rainier.

review.name: Amazing!!
review.reviewBody: Sometimes you book these at your own peril, not knowing what you will get. This one turned out to be truly amazing.  It helps to have a passionate and informative guide, and we had just that.  Sarah was superb in every aspect.  Beginning by quickly learning everyone's name that was on the tour (9 of us I believe).  She continued to use our names for the entire day, not forgetting any. It helped she grew up in the area, and has a sincere appreciation for what she does.  You could tell the genuine love she has for this area, and the Park.  She had countless stories and examples of cool stuff to see and do, even outside of the tour. It can be difficult to manage a group of people in an orderly way, but she did it less like a heard, and more like a guide.  She faced countless questions from the group, and answered all, meaningfully and respectfully. Even when my youngest wanted all her attention during the tide pool exploring, she managed to be there for everyone.  From the ferry ride, to the hike to the falls, she was 100% there and engaged.  On top of all of that, she was training another individual.  Sarah was amazing in every way, and I cant imagine what the tour would have been without her.  Book this tour, and ask for Sarah.

review.name: Fantastic Trip to the Park!
review.reviewBody: The "Excellent" reviews are definitely accurate!  Daniel took us into the park and showed us the sights.  The views are truly majestic!  Daniel was knowledgeable and his commentary spot on.  The picnic lunch was elegant and exceeded all expectations.  Never felt rushed and Daniel took extra time to ensure that we had plenty of time at each stop.

review.name: Memorable day in Olympic National Park, thanks to excellent guide
review.reviewBody: Cannot recommend this tour highly enough. Daniel is a congenial, knowledgeable guide. He took us to mile-high Hurricane Ridge, with stunning views of snow-capped peaks, for a delicious picnic lunch (complete with tablecloth and cloth napkins!) near a rushing river and waterfall, and to Crescent Lake, for an easy 2-mile hike through old growth forest.  Being in a small group (6 of us) and with an excellent driver made for a stress—free way to be introduced to this spectacular place. Daniel timed everything perfectly - we never felt rushed.  We felt privileged to be able to spend a day in the presence of such majestic beauty.

review.name: Incredible
review.reviewBody: This was by far one of the best day tours I have ever gone on! Our guide was so nice, thoughtful, and caring and couldn’t have made us feel more welcome! We had an amazing time and the sites were beautiful. Not too much walking and plenty of time to relax. The food was amazing and fresh. Our guide was so informative and just a great person overall. Would recommend to anyone!

review.name: Sarah’s the Best!
review.reviewBody: Sarah (PNW) was an outstandingly awesome guide; knowledgeable, friendly, super accommodating, and 100% what I would recommend for anyone seeking to explore the Pacific North West. I’m coming back to do another Evergreen Escapes tour and asking for Sarah, the absolute sweetheart, again.

review.name: Trip A
review.reviewBody: Very nice visit to a beautiful park.  Daniel was raised in this area and is very knowledgeable and passionate about Olympic Park. Very attentive and desired to ensure everyone enjoyed the trip. Liked the small group.

itemListElement.name: Mount Rainier National Park Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch

name: Mount Rainier National Park Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch
description: Explore pristine alpine meadows, wander through magical old growth forests, and watch roaring glacial waterfalls crash into rugged canyons on this small group day tour to Mount Rainier National Park. The snowcapped peak, encased in over 35 square miles (91 km²) of ice year-round, is endearingly referred to locally as “The Mountain” and is a must-visit Seattle day trip. Throughout the day, you'll enjoy meaningful commentary on the history, culture, and geology of the region from an expert local guide. The tour includes a gourmet lunch, park admission, and pick-up/drop-off at your Seattle hotel in our luxury Mercedes van.

review.name: What an amazing day
review.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the day and all the beautiful surroundings of Mt. Rainier. Daniel was an excellent guide. He kept the whole group entertained with tits and bits of information from the time we sat in the van. Our group was great and lunch was great.

review.name: Perfect Day visiting Mt Rainer National Park
review.reviewBody:
This tour was the highlight of our trip to Seattle. Daniel was an excellent tour guide! He is friendly, personable, knowledgeable about the area, prepared, and a good safe driver. 
Daniel picked us up at our hotel at 7:45am. On the drive to Mt Rainer National Park, he told us about our day, the park and asked what our activity level was so he could gear the tour to meet our needs. We stopped on the way for a bathroom break and had delicious pastries he had picked up from a local bakery. He also provided us with coffee, water, soft drinks, snacks throughout the day. 
At the park we went on several guided short hikes, saw three beautiful waterfalls, Paradise and reflection Lake. We even had a chance to explore the lodge there. We had a wonderful gourmet picnic lunch complete with tablecloth, cloth napkins, real plates and wine. After returning to Seattle around 6pm, Daniel dropped us off at the waterfront so we didn’t have to walk there or get an Uber from our hotel. 
It was a perfect day and the mountain was visible in all its glory. I highly recommend Daniel with Yonder Sky Tours. He was so great, we did another tour the next day with him to Snoqualmie Falls and Woodinville wineries. Another awesome tour!

review.name: exceptional tour experience with Daniel
review.reviewBody: Daniel is professional, careful, and knowledgeable about everything we saw during the tour. He got everything prepared including food, beverages, and showed up on time to pick me up. And really appreciate the extra attention he gave me since I was on this tour by myself.

review.name: Mt. Rainier Tour
review.reviewBody: This was such a beautiful trip with our guide, Daniel. He picked us up at our hotel, and we were on our way to Mt. Rainier. Daniel is from the area and was able to provide insight on everything we stopped to look at. He found a variety of stunning areas to see on our journey up to Paradise. It was very well rounded, and every stop was perfect. Once we reached Paradise, he gave us time to explore on our own. On the journey back down, we had a wonderful gourmet lunch. Then we made a couple more sightseeing stops. The weather didn’t cooperate with us, so we never got a great view of the top of Mt. Rainer. That’s a risk when booking these trips, but the day was still great. The photos really don’t do it justice.

review.name: Luxury and Majesty wrapped into one
review.reviewBody: Excellent tour!  Great attention to detail.  Amazing stops along the way up and down the mountain.  Heartfelt love and knowledge of area by our guide.  Thankful to be picked up and dropped off at our hotel- with coffee and pastries in the morning- delicious gourmet meal on the mountain for lunch- and pick me up snack in the afternoon.  Pace was very good.  Worth every penny of this trip!

review.name: Mt Rainier
review.reviewBody: Trip was well organized - Daniel was so awesome and considerate as a tour guide ... well worth your time to use him!  Great knowledge and really a great time learning and seeing about this national park

review.name: The Perfect day
review.reviewBody: From 8am to 6pm we were in good hands. Daniel was attentive to details and flexed our tour to suit the weather and crowds of the day. This made for a very comfortable and seemless experience. Daniel was personable, interesting and inclusive with our group of 6. Continental breakfast, gourmet lunch and planned rest stops added to the quality of the tour. Our family of four adults highly recommend booking your Mt Rainier tour with Seattle native Daniel at Yonder Sky.

review.name: Beauty all around
review.reviewBody: Daniel was an amazing tour guide. He was friendly and knowledgeable. The food he picked for lunch was amazing!!!  It was a rainy and cold day, but we still had a great time!  I can already tell this is going to be the highlight of our trip to Seattle!!!  I would highly recommend this tour to anyone that wants to make sure they see all of the beauty this National park has to offer.

review.name: #1 choice for day trips from Seattle
review.reviewBody:
My sister and I booked this tour for our trip to Washington. We liked everything this tour offered in its description--small group, all inclusive and a detailed itinerary with multiple scenic stops. Daniel, who owns and operates Yonder Sky, picked us up at our hotel and we traveled with 5 others (total of 7 passengers) in a comfortable Mercedes van. Our first rest stop was 1 hour away, where he offered us delicious breakfast pastries and a surprisingly broad selection of beverages! We then traveled another hour to Mt. Rainier (all of this time flew by because of the great conversations we were having). Daniel took us to several different spots, including many waterfalls and into the old growth forest with a brief, guided walk. Our stop at Paradise was flexible, we could either follow him and hike to Myrtle Falls and get a closer view of Mt. Rainier, or spend the time however we liked. We ate a picnic-style lunch (chicken, noodle, salad, etc.) at a table in the park, which was great as well. Daniel made sure we were hydrated and really enjoying the trip. After a couple more stops, we headed back towards Seattle and he offered to drop us off at the hotels or wherever else in the area we preferred to continue our trip. This tour was wonderful and definitely one of the highlights during our trip. Daniel was kind, accommodating, and knowledgeable. Everything felt comfortable, like going on a family trip or trip with friends rather than a tour. If you are thinking of booking a day tour, going with Yonder Sky is the way to go. We could not have imagined a better experience of Mt. Rainier!!

PS- the views were so breathtaking that my photos look almost unreal, but I promise I took them during the tour!

review.name: A great day in Mt. Ranier National Park with Daniel
review.reviewBody: I booked this tour only about a week prior and had excellent and quick communication from Matt about booking and pick up at our local hotel.   I didn't even do much research on the trip and I will admit I was blown away by the tour and the area we saw.  I am normally a DIY tour person and I am so glad I booked with Matt and Daniel.  Daniel was our guide for the 6 people in the luxury van and we saw so much more than if I had tried to tour on my own.  We learned a lot about the area, did some light hikes, saw beautiful waterfalls and visited so many great vistas.  Our lunch was wonderful.  It was so nice to have real placemats, silverware, cups and plates wine and super tasty food instead of some kind of sack lunch.  I will be booking with Yonder Sky again next time we are in the area.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Wine and Waterfall Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch

name: Seattle Wine and Waterfall Luxury Small-Group Day Tour with Lunch
description: Refine your palate at our region's renowned Woodinville wineries and experience geology in motion at Washington’s most dramatic waterfall on this small group day tour to Snoqualmie Falls and Seattle wineries. Washington is now the nation’s second largest wine-producing state, and Woodinville alone has over 130 wineries. Throughout the day, you'll enjoy meaningful commentary on the history, culture, and geology of the region from an expert local guide. The tour includes a gourmet lunch at a local restaurant, wine tasting fees, and pick-up/drop-off at your Seattle hotel in our luxury Mercedes van.

review.name: Worthwhile
review.reviewBody:
I loved the idea of spending the day with a "small group" and small it was:  the Tour Guide Daniel, me and my husband and one other couple; just five of us.  The front passenger seat was empty, so we could have easily and comfortably carried six people -- that's the Tour Guide plus five guests.  I think they limit the number of guests to seven.  If so, that will not be comfortable.  Maybe it's seven total people in the vehicle; but even so, three people will have to share a bench seat.  Depending on the size of the people, as well as the mobility and flexibility of the people, that might not be comfortable.  I recommend Matt and Daniel limit the number of guests to five.

This is Daniel's business, so he is very conscientious.  He confirmed with me in advance; confirmed the pickup time and location.  

As promised, he had coffee, bottled water and snacks.  He provided us with snacks throughout the day, mostly delicious pastries.

We had lunch at the Heritage Restaurant in Woodinville.  Lunch was very good; the restaurant was clean, the service good, the price included in the cost of the tour, and the food was delicious and fresh.  BUT I thought that the "gourmet lunch" was going to be served at one of the wineries, which wasn't the case.

We did visit Snoqualish Falls, which was nice.  We also visited three wineries and did wine tasting.  And we stopped at an old train station to use the facilities and stretch our legs.

The van is new, clean and comfortable.  Daniel was on time.  We were treated well at  each of the wineries.  Daniel chose the three wineries well, starting with Chateau St. Michelle which is a big corporation, then a small winery and then an itty bitty winery.  

It was a very pleasant day.  We enjoyed the company of Chelsea and Megan, as well as Daniel.  I with them much success in their business venture.  I do recommend this tour.

review.name: AMAZING TOUR!
review.reviewBody: Today we went on the wine and waterfall tour with Matt and it has been AMAZING!  Matt has been very knowledgeable and so personable. We are so lucky that we decided to go on this tour because it has been a day to remember. Taking us to the beautiful falls and ending in some delicious wineries with his wealth of knowledge in between.  If you don’t go on this tour with Matt you are missing out. Thank you for a great adventure it was awesome.

review.name: Small touches make a difference
review.reviewBody: Did a Wine and Waterfall Tour with Yondersky. Our guide Daniel was very helpful and knowledgeable. The little extras, coffee and pastries at our first stop and brownies and cheese later in the day made a difference. We chose Chateau Saint Michelle which was a bit soulless but Daniel chose Feseste and Obelisco were excellent.

review.name: The only wine tour to take
review.reviewBody: Small groups, relaxed,professional with a great lunch BEFORE heading over to start tasting some of the best of Woodinville's wines. Matt did an exceptional job of educating us about the area and getting a 'feel' for the types of wines we were interested in tasting. Start with Chateau St. Michelle, get it over with. Then let Matt take you to taste some of the finest wines available in Woodinville, believe me, he knows. I got to taste (and purchase) a world class Cab and Savigion Blanc from 2 wineries I never would have been able to find, much less go in for a tasting. Some of these family owned, boutique wineries are producing the finest wines available anywhere. Door to door service, beautiful waterfall, excellent guide, great lunch followed by incredible wines. There is no better way to spend a day when visiting Seattle. Deserves way more than 5 stars.

review.name: Great time with great wine
review.reviewBody: Matt picked us up at our hotel. Took us to the waterfall and let us hike the park if we wanted to do so. Had a great lunch at a very good restaurant. Took us to 3 small wineries, where we had some good tasting wines. Feed us some delicious snacks a long the way. Matt also kept us entertained with some great information about Seattle and the surrounding areas. Highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Great sampling of Washington wines with waterfall visit.
review.reviewBody: This is a very nice small group tour. Only 6 of us and visited 3 Washington wineries. The main one of course is Chateau Saint Michelle then 2 local places that were actually quite good. Stopped at nice local place for lunch where we had a very very good faro risotto. Dan was a great host and lots of wine was included. Highly recommend this tour....Waterfall a little overrated, but that’s just a personal preference if you are into that. 👍👍

review.name: Must do Tour
review.reviewBody: We just guessed when booking a tour and ended up with the best of the best tour you could imagine. We enjoyed everything about this tour and our tour guide Daniel. He made everything extra special with his personal touches. Don't look any further is you want a small and personal tour. Thank you Daniel for this great experience.

review.name: Seattle Wine and Waterfall
review.reviewBody: Daniel was great. A perfect way to see Seattle's surrounding area and taste great wine. Highly recommend this day tour.

review.name: A Great Day for Wine & a Waterfall
review.reviewBody: I would highly recommend Daniel’s tour of the falls and winery tours.  Daniel is very knowledgeable about the area, super friendly and provided us with a great day of sightseeing, food and wine.  The small group was perfect!  Thanks again.

review.name: THIS is the way to see Seattle Wine Country!
review.reviewBody: While a bit more expensive than some of the other tours you may be looking at, this tour is worth every penny. Read all the details of everything that's included - it truly is a "luxury" tour. Snoqualmie Falls and wine tasting at it's best!  Everything is included in the price including a lovely organic and locally sourced lunch at one of Woodinville's best restaurants (we were able to choose what we wanted off the menu and everything was delicious).  Wine tastings are all included and our guide, Matt, tailored our tasting to the types of wines our group was interested in.  It's a choose your own adventure tour where you have a say in what you'd like to see and do. Matt was also very knowledgable about the lore of the Snoqualmie Falls area and was very well versed in the local wineries and the surrounding agriculture.  Overall the trip was friendly, fun, and just what we were looking for.  Forget those big corporate tours where you'll still end up buying your own lunch or wine tastings - let these guys treat you right and give you everything you need.

itemListElement.name: Full-Day Small-Group Bainbridge Island Wine and History Tour

name: Full-Day Small-Group Bainbridge Island Wine and History Tour
description: Experience Pacific Northwest island life, history, and wine on this all-inclusive small group day tour of beautiful Bainbridge Island. We’ll start the day with a scenic ferry ride from Seattle followed by a leisurely tour of this island’s colorful past. In the afternoon, it’s all fun as we explore the island’s budding winery scene by visiting two local producers. The tour includes a gourmet lunch, admission fees, winery tasting fees, and pick-up at your Seattle hotel in our luxury Mercedes van.

review.name: great
review.reviewBody:
Fletcher Bay Winery is a MUST stop. Fabulous wine and great noches. I will stop in again, first stop.
d

review.name: Amazing Tour on the island
review.reviewBody: A number of things made this a fabulous trip:  it was small (just the 5 of us), so we really got to set the pace for the day; a lot of outdoor activities that displayed the beauty of the island; the lunch on the beach was delicious!; Daniel is very knowledgeable about history and the island.  Highly recommend!

review.name: Wonderful day trip!
review.reviewBody:
Can't really say enough good things about our day trip with Daniel to Bainbridge Island. Because he grew up there, he was able to provide lots of insight into things we wouldn't have gotten with just 'any' tour guide.  
Once we arrived via ferry, the day went by quickly as we strolled through the beautiful gardens and got to see first-hand the Japanese internment memorial.  The lunch was amazing!!  A feast of multiple tasty dishes that are not the standard box lunch you would expect on a tour like this.
The wineries he took us to were lovely boutique-type operations with very tasty wines and info from the owner/winemaker at one of the stops. 
Daniel made sure everyone on the trip was well cared for and he explained in detail everything that was planned and what was coming next.  Do yourself a favor and book your tour with Yonder Sky.  You won't be disappointed!

review.name: Bainbridge Island Tour
review.reviewBody: Great trip. Daniel was very personable and professional.  Was very knowledgeable about the area and it’s history.  The lunch was wonderful and fun - quality of a 4 star restaurant.  Wine tasting was also fun and interesting.  Highly recommend this tour with Daniel or Matt.

review.name: Amazing day tour!!
review.reviewBody:
We did the Bainbridge Island tour on June 8 with Daniel and it was beyond our expectations.  We were picked up (on time!) from our hotel in a well-kept, spacious vehicle, and were immediately welcomed by Daniel.  The ferry ride provided some great views of the city, and we were provided with hot beverages and pastries for the ride.
The hike through the Bloedel Reserve was beautiful, and was done at a pace that suited everyone in our group of 7.
Lunch was served on a beach, and consisted of chicken, salmon, a variety of salads, and fresh baguette - absolutely delicious!!
The wineries that we visited had great ambiance, and included with the tour was tastings at each.
Overall experience was fantastic and Daniel was very knowledgeable  - I would highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Tour of Bainbridge Island
review.reviewBody: We knew coming to Seattle that we wanted to visit Bainbridge Island during our stay.  We decided to book the Bainbridge Wine and History Tour with Yonder Sky and we are so glad we did.  Daniel, who grew up on Bainbridge Island, picked us up at our hotel sharply at 9:00am in his Mercedes van.  He had pastries, coffee, drinks and snacks for the ferry ride over to Bainbridge.  He was an excellent host and tour guide.  He took us for a drive to the shore on our way to Bloedel Reserve.  We toured the incredible grounds and estate home.  If you are an outdoors and nature lover you need to see this place.  The trail walk through the beautiful woods and gardens was about 2 miles in length.  We walked at our own leisurely pace and took lots of pictures.  Our next stop was lunch at a local cafe housed within the beautiful Bainbridge Island Museum of Art.  We spent some time in the museum itself before going to see the Japanese American Exclusion Memorial.  It was a stark reminder of darker days in American history.  Daniel was really able to make the visit to the Memorial more personal as he went to grade school and high school with grandchildren and great grandchildren of some of the Bainbridge Japanese American residents who were sent to internment camps during WWII.  Following the memorial we did some wine tastings at a few local wineries.  Eagle Harbor winery was an exceptional treat.  At our request and in lieu of the third wine tasting stop, we spent some time walking in downtown Bainbridge.  We stopped in the local grocery store and Daniel picked up some smoked salmon dip to go with crackers as a snack for our ferry ride back to Seattle.  We had a wonderful day on this tour and Daniel was a terrific tour guide.  We would highly recommend using Yonder Sky if you’re planning a visit to Bainbridge Island. Wine and History Tour with Yonder Sky and we are so glad we did.  Daniel, who grew up on Bainbridge Island, picked us up at our hotel sharply at 9:00am in his Mercedes van.  He had pastries, coffee, drinks and snacks for the ferry ride over to Bainbridge.  He was an excellent host and tour guide.  He took us for a drive to the shore on our way to Bloedel Reserve.  We toured the incredible grounds and estate home.  If you are an outdoors and nature lover you need to see this place.  The trail walk through the beautiful woods and gardens was about 2 miles in length.  We walked at our own leisurely pace and took lots of pictures.  Our next stop was lunch at a local cafe housed within the beautiful Bainbridge Island Museum of Art.  We spent some time in the museum itself before going to see the Japanese American Exclusion Memorial.  It was a stark reminder of darker days in American history.  Daniel was really able to make the visit to the Memorial more personal as he went to grade school and high school with grandchildren and great grandchildren of some of the Bainbridge Japanese American residents who were sent to internment camps during WWII.  Following the memorial we did some wine tastings at a few local wineries.  Eagle Harbor winery was an exceptional treat.  At our request and in lieu of the third wine tasting stop, we spent some time walking in downtown Bainbridge.  We stopped in the local grocery store and Daniel picked up some smoked salmon dip to go with crackers as a snack for our ferry ride back to Seattle.  We had a wonderful day on this tour and Daniel was a terrific tour guide.  We would highly recommend using Yonder Sky if you’re planning a visit to Bainbridge Island.

review.name: Bainbridge Tour
review.reviewBody:
If you want a tour that includes meeting new people either single adults, couples or friends, then this is a tour for you.

Our host Daniel was very knowledgable respectful, funny and kind.

He was punctual and greeted us in a very warm way, ensuring we were comfortable in his vehicle. 

We had another nice couple join in on the day.

The itinerary was filled with island beauty on Bainbridge Island after a nice ferry ride across the sound. He was fully prepared with pastries, coffee, tea, water etc.. to make our trip as pleasant as possible. 

Daniel was happy to answer any questions we had about the island history, inhabitants past and present. The tour was carefully planned to enhance our day. We had time to reflect on  historical events that included information on local Indian tribes that once inhabited these islands and most recent in some of the lifetimes of family perhaps grandparents of the 20th century who were around during WWII. The Japanese  Memorial on the island  is a good reminder and reflection of islanders affected. A must see.

Daniel took us to have a wonderful lunch in town and we were able to talk and get to know each other after which was followed by a great walk in the Bloedel Reserve which was truly amazing to see.

The local wineries were amazing. This tour was carefully choreographed to truly share  what Yonder Sky is all about. 

Showing us the natural, historical, and beauty of the land  and its people.

Thank you to both Daniel and Matt for your hospitality and I can't wait to return to do the rest of your tours.

Best day ever. Sunday, September 16, 2018

Helene Anda

review.name: One of the best experiences we've had in a long time
review.reviewBody: I was skeptical of doing a "tour" but, after reading some of these reviews, I thought I'd give it a try. I'm so glad I did! My partner and I spent the day on Bainbridge Island and felt like locals, thanks to Matt & Daniel's insider knowledge. It was a perfect mix of nature and culture, starting with Bloedel Reserve and ending with some fantastic wine tasting. The food and Mercedes van upped the experience, and the small group setting made it feel special (no orange flags and corralling here!). We come to the Seattle area often and it's now on our list to experience every one of Yonder Sky's tours!

itemListElement.name: Whidbey Island and Deception Pass - Luxury Small Group Day Tour with Lunch

name: Whidbey Island and Deception Pass - Luxury Small Group Day Tour with Lunch
description: This Whidbey Island and Deception Pass tour from Seattle highlights the best of Washington State's famous scenery and lifestyle. Washington’s largest island is packed full of local charm, friendly people, state history, and beautiful vistas. Among the most popular weekend destinations for locals, Whidbey enjoys an idyllic setting and playful energy that make it a rewarding day trip from Seattle. The tour includes a gourmet lunch, park admissions, and pick-up/drop-off at your Seattle hotel in our luxury Mercedes van.

review.name: Great day on Whidbey Island
review.reviewBody: The private group tour to Whidbey Island was excellent! Daniel was our guide, and the tour was exactly what we were looking for.  The day was full of activity, and we hit all the places we wanted to see and a few more. Daniel was extremely flexible and tailored the tour to our group as we went along. The food was great (we had a picnic lunch (Covid)), and he made sure we had water, other drinks, and snacks throughout the day. A great day all around, and we'll make sure to use Yonder Sky again if we get the chance to do another tour in the future. Highly recommend!

review.name: A Great Day on the Coast
review.reviewBody:
The small group tour by Yonder Sky is the best way to visit Whidbey and Deception Pass – a relaxed, comfortable pace with personalized attention. This small group gives you the chance to interact with your fellow travelers and guide.  The new Mercedes van is modern, spacious, clean and comfortable.

Our guide, Daniel, was very knowledgeable and courteous.  He made sure that we got to see the beautiful coastal scenery, interesting sights and provided many photo opportunities. Daniel enthusiastically shared his knowledge of the history of the area, including much about the Native Americans who settled in this area and about the founding of some of Washington’s oldest communities.  

The walk through the woods to the beach at Deception Pass allowed us to get up close to Old Growth Douglas Firs and Western Red Cedars.

We were treated to a nice lunch at a local restaurant in Coupeville, one of the oldest communities in Washington.

After lunch we visited several other interesting and scenic sights including Fort Casey, a World War II military installation, built to protect Puget Sound.

On our return journey to Seattle we took the Clinton Ferry to Mukilteo.  Nice to experience the Washington State ferry system as it is such an integral part of life in this area for work and play. 

Thank you Daniel for such a memorable day and being a weather wizard that was able to change a very rainy forecast miraculously into a nice day.

review.name: Amazing tour of Whidbey Island and Deception pass
review.reviewBody: My brother and I booked this tour for our mother's birthday.  We had such a fabulous day and tour!  Matt was our tour guide and couldn't have been nicer.  He was very professional and had all the accommodations one could ask for, and he even accommodated our nut allergy, as well.  In addition, he was very informative and interesting.  The luxury van was a very comfortable and nice ride.  We had a lovely lunch in an adorable village and we really enjoyed the overall itinerary and stops, as well.  I would highly recommend this tour and I look forward to trying their other tours on our future visits out to the West Coast.

review.name: A very nice Tour! Worth every penny!
review.reviewBody: This is an amazing tour for the Price. It was a beautiful day. Daniel was our Tour Guide and he was very knowledgable about all the areas. Deception Pass was gorgeous even with fog. Whidbey Island, Fort Casey, Coopeville and Langely were great locations. The lunch at Coupeville Restaurant was excellent ! I highly recommend this Tour !

review.name: Perfect day
review.reviewBody: Loved this tour and would highly recommend Yonder Sky.  Matt is a great tour guide and provides a comfortable and enjoyable small group experience.

itemListElement.name: Hike the Gorgeous Trails in Washington

name: Hike the Gorgeous Trails in Washington
description:
Since 2019, Miles Hike Club (MHC) has aimed to provide top-notch experiences for all in the great outdoors. Whether it's your first hike or your 200th, we aim to awaken the inner explorer in all of our guests. At Miles Hike Club, we believe everyone deserves the opportunity to Go Higher! 

With over 20 years of combined experience, our team loves to guide, teach and bond as it will feel like you're hiking with an old friend. With hundreds of 5-star reviews, our team cannot wait to Go Higher with you as we explore the great outdoors.

review.name: Snow Lake, Mount Rainier
review.reviewBody: Our guides were Matt and Connor who were amazing, super helpful and knowledgeable about the area. They gave us options on where we wanted to go, we chose snow lake where they allowed us to spend as much time as we wanted and to swim. They provided us with as much water and as many snacks as we wanted and made sure we were hydrated #hydrateordiedrate, we would definitely do it again if we return to Washington, 10/10 recommend!!🥾⛰️

review.name: Fantastic Hike!
review.reviewBody: I ended up going on a solo hike with Connor, and I had the best time ever. He was so knowledgeable about the nature and wildlife in the area, a fantastic conversationalist, and a great hiking guide in general. I loved the hike and how it was tailored to my fitness level and what I wanted to see. I would absolutely recommend Miles Hike Club to anyone traveling to the Seattle area.

review.name: Fantastic hike and guide
review.reviewBody: This was a really lovely hike and Connor was a fantastic guide. He knew the best place to take us for the weather conditions and was knowledgable about the area. He allowed us to go ‘off piste’ when it was safe to do so which made it extra fun. Highly recommended

review.name: Amazing Experience
review.reviewBody: We did our hike with Boobie and he created an experience that we will never forget. He communicated with us often prior to meeting, was well prepared for the obstacles of the hike, and was very informative and knowledgeable during the hike. Boobie was very professional, enthusiastic, and engaging. The hike was beautiful, but the overall experience was amazing. I would definitely recommend it, do it again, and invite others!

review.name: Perfect Half-Day Trip
review.reviewBody: Our guide, Connor, was knowledgeable and fun, and took us on a great hike to Lake 22.  Definitely recommend.

review.name: Beautiful hike
review.reviewBody: We went as a small group of 4 (including the guide) which was really great. The trail was Rattlesnake ledge and it was a beautiful hike with an amazing view at the top. You got your heartrate up but it wasn't too challenging. All in all a great trip!

review.name: Incredible! 10 stars!
review.reviewBody: My cousin and I had a wonderful time hiking up at Wallace falls. Our guide (Booby) picked the perfect location. Not too easy, but not too hard, and also absolutely beautiful. Definitely recommend!

review.name: Awesome day out hiking to lake 22
review.reviewBody: Hiking to lake 22 with Ismail was fantastic. The hike itself was beautiful, not difficult but a little demanding on occasion. Lake 22 was amazing, very picturesque. Ismail was super nice, friendly, chatty and made it easy to connect. And he is a fountain of knowledge. All in all, this hike was almost like among friends. I highly recommend it.

review.name: Great way to see Seattle's natural beauty
review.reviewBody: Traveling as a single woman who loves the outdoors, I am still hesitant to hike and do a lot of activities solo for various reasons. This was the perfect way for me to see more of the natural beauty near Seattle without having to rent a car or worry about safety. George did a great job leading the hike and providing info on the surrounding areas and even recommending options for the rest of my day. We got an early start, water and snacks were provided, the day turned out to be beautiful, and although my legs were tired after I still had the whole afternoon. I couldn't have asked for better! Highly recommend, would go again for another hike!

review.name: Great hiking experience
review.reviewBody: I had a wonderful time hiking Heather Lake with Mike and Taylor. The hiking trail is tailored to your hiking experience, fitness, and whatever you'd like to see (such as mountains, waterfalls, lakes). They were very friendly and kind. They have hiking equipment like hiking poles, spikes, poncho, that are readily available if needed. We also had a good discussion about hiking tips and beautiful trees along the way. Taylor was very kind to share her hiking experience and help with the planning of my next hiking trip. Overall, it's definitely a great experience if you enjoy hiking!

address.streetAddress: 2600 SW Barton St, Ste B8 Suite B8

name: Seattle Scavenger Hunt Adventure
description: Turn Seattle into a giant game board with this fun scavenger hunt adventure! This challenge combines the excitement of the Amazing Race with a 3-hour city walking tour. Guided from any smart phone, teams make their way among well known and overlooked gems of the city, solving clues and completing challenges while learning local history. Note: Pricing is per individual, but teams must book together in order to be included in the same adventure.

review.name: Self guided puzzle tour of Seattle
review.reviewBody: Informative adventure we enjoyed!  We learned new things and noticed things we never would have if not for this quest.  A bit of a bummer because of covid-19 closures.

itemListElement.name: Shared Departure Transfer: Hotels to Seattle-Tacoma Airport

name: Shared Departure Transfer: Hotels to Seattle-Tacoma Airport
description: When leaving Seattle, enjoy hassle-free transport to Seattle–Tacoma International Airport (SEA) with this convenient airport transfer service from hotels in downtown Seattle or the Queen Anne district. Transfers are available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Relax in a deluxe Mercedes-Benz shuttle that provides door-to-door service, onboard video entertainment and Wi-Fi.

itemListElement.name: Chocolate Indulgence Walking Tour of Seattle

name: Chocolate Indulgence Walking Tour of Seattle
description: Chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate! If the mere mention of the word brings a smile to your face, this is the tour of Seattle you have been searching for. Explore the sweet side of the city as you visit some of Seattle's best confectioners and chocolate makers on a Chocolate Walking Tour.

review.name: This Tour was Chocolatey Goodness!
review.reviewBody:
Truly enjoyed this tour!  
We would highly recommend it and it was worth the cost of the tour.  Betsy was very informative and by the end of the tour, I was chocolated out.

review.name: Perfect Girls Activity
review.reviewBody: Betsy led this tour for my and some of my gal pals. We had a blast with the info, the samplings, and we even got a chance to speak with the owner and founder of Indi! Totally recommend this tour AND Betsy!!!!!

review.name: Absolutely  DELIGHTFUL!
review.reviewBody: if I had the time, I would go on this tour regularly! I'm not even a "chocolholic" but it was that good! I love the first stop with the chocolate martini. I've done other Savor Seattle tours and all the guides are engaging and funny. I recognized one as an actor that I've seen in plays. The tour lasts the perfect amount of time and the walking is very easy. With the holidays approaching, could be a fun family or friends outing!

review.name: Chocolate, Chocolate, Chocolate
review.reviewBody: Marlee was an outstanding tour guide and we visited 5 outstanding locations in the Pike Place market area. Each location had different choclolate treats and all were outstanding.  Great tour and will do it again with friends from out of town.

review.name: Worth the $ our families fave memory!
review.reviewBody: Will did a great job, very interesting kept it light-hearted and informative. Very personable! Worth the $$

review.name: Yummy Fun
review.reviewBody: Great tour, yummy samples, interesting info, kind guide, comfortable pace -- very nice taste of Seattle.

review.name: Fun splurge event
review.reviewBody: What a great time! The desserts were all amazing and the tour guide (Will) was nice and had an amazing knowledge of both chocolate and Seattle. Well worth the time and money. Definitely recommend.

review.name: Fun two hours spent eating chocolate
review.reviewBody: Read this first. I had to bow out of the chocolate eating about halfway through the tour, at Indie's in Pikes Market. That's how much chocolate you have to eat on this tour. We stopped at multiple places (even one where they served coconut cream pie, Dahlia's Bakery {I think}) and my wife and kids loved it. Along with the pie, we had cupcakes, brownies, cookies, cheesecake, liquid chocolate, and Obama's favorite: Fran's Chocolates. It was darn near overwhelming. Our tour left at 11am and we obviously skipped lunch that day, but walked it off later around the Market and taking a tour on the Seattle City Pass (Space Needle, MoPop Museum, etc...). Well worth the price. I say do it, you'll adore it...and ask for Marley. She was a great tour guide.

review.name: The more you know about chocolate
review.reviewBody:
JB was our guide, not only was he very knowledgeable about the history of chocolate, he told us the reason on why he loved chocolate..which most of us could relate. JB answered questions that we asked and gave us info on each place that we stopped at. 
Thank you for the wonderful chocolate experience 
Only issue was the price of parking, $72 for 4 hrs

review.name: Chocolate for breakfast? Absolutely!
review.reviewBody: My wife, 8 and 12 year old, and I just enjoyed the chocolate indulgence walking tour for Mother’s Day. So much great chocolate and interesting history of both Seattle food scene and how chocolate plays a role locally. Will the tour guide was a kick. Thanks for a great experience to be a tourist in our own city.

itemListElement.name: Early-Bird Tasting Tour of Pike Place Market

name: Early-Bird Tasting Tour of Pike Place Market
description:
Explore Pike Place Market, Seattle’s top attraction, with an early-bird tasting tour. Discover the market’s many delights as you visit different food vendors for 8+ tastings of fruit, salmon, pastries, international fare, and more. As an early-bird you'll visit merchants before the crowds arrive, and you’ll have a knowledgeable guide to expertly lead you around, entertaining you with stories about the market's history and culture. Explore the greatest hits and hidden gems of the Pike Place market during this experience. 

♦ Show Me Seattle is permitted and licensed by the Pike Place Market Preservation and Development Authority (PDA) to operate tours in the Pike Place Market Historical District. The PDA requires any business or person conducting paid tours within its properties and in the public areas of the historical district to be pre-approved and to have a license for this activity.♦

review.name: Great tour with Lucky
review.reviewBody: I came to the market a couple years ago and was overwhelmed by the size and felt like I didn’t really get to see everything. So this time I decided to schedule the tour and I’m so glad I did. Our tour guide Lucky was great. You get to see the market before it gets too crowded, learn the history, taste some great samples. He spent extra time making sure you always knew where you were and how to get back there later.

review.name: Politics
review.reviewBody: Lucky was knowledgable and fun… until he thought it was wise to preach his misguided view of the Middle East conflict?! Politics have no place on a food tour!

review.name: Lucky and Loads of Fun
review.reviewBody: We loved visiting Pikes Place! Lucky, our guide, was so knowledgeable about the market and in general. I learned so much and felt connected. It was really a great experience. The vendors and the food were wonderful!

review.name: Highly recommend for visitors and locals!
review.reviewBody:
This tour is amazing! It’s a great way to learn about the history of Pike Place Market and sample some of the delicious foods from different café's and shops. Our guide, Lucky, was unbelievably knowledgeable and very fun! The tour is great for both visitors and locals: walk all around through multiple buildings, learn secret places and shortcuts, hear about history of the market and Seattle, eat and laugh! Our family (from teens to adults) enjoyed every minute!
Tip: dress for the weather! The market occupies multiple buildings, you’ll walk a lot on the streets, and many buildings are open to the outside.

review.name: Left the tour hungry and underwhelmed.
review.reviewBody:
I was disappointed with the "Tasting Tour of Pike Place Market" as it didn't meet my expectations of having more food tastings. The tour was only 15% food tasting and was more focused on history, running way over schedule. While our guide was extremely informative and nice. Some stops weren't even food-related, which could have been skipped to keep the tour on time. The tour included 7 food tastings and 2 drink tastings, but I felt teased at some places we learned about the food without getting to taste it. Notably, 2 of the food tastings were available for free outside of the tour. Overall, I left the tour hungry and underwhelmed for the price.

Suggest renaming the tour to "Pike Place History with Tastings Tour"?

review.name: Time changed by guide
review.reviewBody:
Time changed from text from guide, less than 24 hr begore tour.
Soo I could not go and still was charged for tour.
Very unhappy with this.
Would not recommend  your service

review.name: Great tour guide and delicious food/drink samples!
review.reviewBody: Lucky was such a great tour guide!  We highly recommend him.  We could have never imagined seeing so much of Pike Place Market on our own, and everything we sampled was delicious!  Definitely recommend this tour!  Do it!

review.name: Great Tour
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide Lucky made this such a great tour. He was very knowledgeable and funny and could tell really enjoyed being a guide

review.name: Pike's Place Awesome!
review.reviewBody: Lucky was engaged, super knowledgeable and friendly. Highly recommend! Samples were delicious! Market is incredible!

review.name: Great for first timers to the area
review.reviewBody:
Our guide, Lucky, was a wonderful storyteller.  He knew about the history of the area as well as Pike Place Market.  The only thing I would potentially change is the name of the tour.  While we did taste many items, my feeling is that it was more of a tour of the Market, with some tastings along the way.  I thought it was going to be more food focussed on its entirety.

That said, I would highly recommend this tour.  We loved it!

name: Gourmet Seattle Walking Tour
description: Discover Seattle's tastiest restaurants on a leisurely walking tour of Seattle. Embrace upscale comfort food and enjoy an introduction to some of Seattle's most popular restaurants and meet the chefs as you eat your way through the city at a leisurely pace.

review.name: Great tour!
review.reviewBody: This was a wonderful tour  of Seattle restaurants.  We had  samples of food at each restaurant.  The restaurants were ready for us and our tour guide was very knowledgeable.  Great ending with chocolate!

review.name: Wonderful Time
review.reviewBody: We were so happy we took this tour. We'd never done a food tour of a city before. Our tour guide was nice and so knowledgeable. We loved the food and we went to one of the restaurants we ate in the next day to eat. Wonderful.

review.name: Bring snacks?
review.reviewBody: My friend and I almost missed the tour, because the ticket we printed up had outdated information listing a previously included restaurant. The guide said he had sent a confirmation email with the current address, but I never got it. Luckily, the staff at that restaurant, told us that we were at the wrong location, and called the tour operators, to verify the new location (this restaurant had previously been included in the tour). If we had not checked in with the staff at that restaurant, we would have missed the tour and not received a refund. Anyway, back to the food and the tour. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable, and the tastings were delicious. Some better than others. My friend had her slice of pizza soaked with water when the guide accidentally knocked over the water on the pizza. I get it, things happen, and it was an accident, but at least order more pizza. The overall food quality was a 4 out of 5. The volume of food was a 2 out of 5. The tour guide's knowledge and friendliness was a 4 out of 5. We were still hungry after the tour, and then went to dinner. Almost missing the tour was a 0 out of 5, but thankfully we were helped back to the correct address. We have both done other food tours in other cities, almost a dozen between us. This would be a better value at about 65.00 per person, considering the small amounts of food.

review.name: Disappointed
review.reviewBody: I want to start off by saying our tour guide was amazing and I do appreciate her kind and fun energy. I've been on several food tours and enjoy cooking very much myself. For the price of this tour and the title including the word gourmet I was expecting a lot more to expand my palate in a place such as Seattle. Unfortunately I don't feel like I got that from this tour. Normally on food tours we try very different things that do flow together in some kind of way. On this particular tour we had salmon in two different dishes, truffle oil in two different dishes, and not much of a variety for anything else in my opinion. I did come hungry and I also left hungry. I understand that five stops means the plates will be smaller but it was done in such a way that I just left disappointed and so did all my friends. If I had to rename this tour I would call it bites of Seattle and leave gourmet out of it. I also would put in the description that it would focus on possibly seafood instead of just a food tour in general as we had that in three of five dishes. Lastly I was confused on how they went about deciding the drinks to go along with the dishes. We went to a place that focuses on over a thousand spirits yet we were served a local pilsner. At one other place we were served a cocktail, but the base was a pilsner. So again not much of a variety in the drinks either. The information the tour guide gave us was very interesting but it's sad if you want what she talked about way more than anything you were served. Until they do a better job with this tour I would recommend to my friends coming to Seattle to try different tours like the coffee tour or the underground tour instead of wasting their money on this one. I come from a smaller town on the East coast and they put on way more of an amazing food tour (for a fraction of the price still featuring unique and gourmet food) whether you are a foodie or just someone looking to try something new.

review.name: Educational,  fun AND delicious!
review.reviewBody: I wasn't 100% sure what to expect from the tour but it exceeded anything I could have guessed it to be. Matt was a hoot from the start, he was very informative as well as fun and a really great speaker. Unlike tours ive been on he was very personal not just with me but the other members of the group. I enjoyed the other tourists, some were local, some visiting just like me. Each location we got to taste both a small dish and a drink that paired well with the dish. I didn't realize until the end of the tour how far we had actually walked. During the walks Matt would give us fun facts about locations we were passing and suggestions on additional locations that were not necessarily part of the tour and I loved that! We also got a discount card at the end of the tour as well as a $25 giftcard to one of the restaurants that would last up to 3 months. I used the giftcard at Heartwood Provisions as I had been wanting to go there anyways. Overall a fantastic tour, I would even go on it again.

review.name: Very enjoyable
review.reviewBody: We were a nice small group of 6, including our guide Elizabeth.  Made some new friends, and enjoyed hearing histories of the restaurants we visited, as well as those that we walked past.  Learned some fun facts about Seattle, and were treated to delicious food.  I would highly recommend the tour.

review.name: Fun afternoon adventure
review.reviewBody:
We were 4 of a group of 8 guests on the 2:30pm Gourmet Walking Tour and very much enjoyed the adventure. The other two couples were very much into the tour as we were.
Our guide Heather was a delight and very restaurant savvy. Lots of info on the restaurants and chefs involved as well as the Seattle foodie scene. We visit Seattle often but still learned many interesting facts.
The food tastings were all excellent and informative. Although I admit the drink “pairings” at some locations were meagre in volume.
We did use the Coupon from the Walking tour for a discount on our lunch the following day. Quite honestly we were not hungry at all after the Tour and just shared a Cheese & Charcuterie plate later that evening.
Thank’s Heather.

review.name: Well thought out and excellent participation
review.reviewBody: Nice blend of eateries. Knowledgeable guide. Entertaining walk. Very involved staff at the restaurants. Some talk of politics initiated by the guide could have lead to confrontation. There were some communication issues re: alcohol and minors in our party. I probably wont do it again, but I certainly don't regret it.

review.name: Great Afternoon of Food & Drinks!
review.reviewBody: This tour was really great! Good variety and quality of foods, unique drink pairings, and covered a nice section of downtown. Tour guide Heather was very friendly and informative! She did an excellent job sharing stories about the city/restaurants backgrounds. The tour leaves you off in a great area and at a good time to make use of the discount card given to you at the end of the tour. One small thing but I do wish that shared dish was split better (I’m a little bummed I ended up with the piece of pizza with no toppings).

review.name: Must Do in Seattle
review.reviewBody:
We have been to Seattle many times from Vancouver, Canada.  Seattle has many things to do and see while you are there.  This tour by far has to be one of my favourite tours we have been one.  Heather was our tour guide her passion and knowledge of food and the city was amazing.  If you love food and want to learn about the city don't hesitate to book this tour.

Heather thank you so much for a great afternoon and we went back to Serious Pizza for dinner so yummy.

itemListElement.name: Capitol Hill Food Tour in Seattle

name: Capitol Hill Food Tour in Seattle
description: Dive into the hip food scene of Seattle’s Capitol Hill neighborhood, home to some of the city’s best restaurants, cafes, coffee houses, bars and nightclubs. Enjoy more than 14 food tastings including cupcakes, Montreal inspired bagels, shrimp n' grits, spicy Korean-style tacos and frozen custard, as well as a handcrafted cocktail and a hard cider tasting. Go behind the scenes of a local bakery, visit an acclaimed food truck featured on ‘Good Morning America,' and enjoy some great people-watching as you hear stories about the history of Capitol Hill from your friendly, knowledgeable guide.

review.name: JASON OBA - GREATEST TOUR GUIDE I HAVE EVER HAD
review.reviewBody: I was visiting my son in Seattle this past week and on April 21, 2018, him and a group of his friends went on Savor Seattle tour.  It was the best time I have had in a long time and Jason Oba was AWESOME tour guide and very knowledgeable about the history in Seattle. He made my last night in Seattle for this trip, a great memory...thank you Jason.  Savor Seattle is very lucky to have you and we were even luckier.

name: Pike Place Market Tasting Tour
description:
Eat your way through Seattle's most celebrated culinary landmark -- Pike Place Market. Go behind the scenes on a walking tour to experience some of the city's favorite market spots. Taste locally made foods and meet our favorite vendors as you learn the colorful history of the Market from your charming and knowledgable guide. 

♦ Show Me Seattle is permitted and licensed by the Pike Place Market Preservation and Development Authority (PDA) to operate tours in the Pike Place Market Historical District. The PDA requires any business or person conducting paid tours within its properties and in the public areas of the historical district to be pre-approved and to have a license for this activity.♦

review.name: Disappointed
review.reviewBody: Visited Pike Place like everyone else for the entertainment value watching them toss fish and wanted my 87 year old father-in-law to witness the surrounds. The individual with the beard then yells out to everyone while he's boxing up $600.00 of over priced fish, "THIS IS A FISH MARKET, NOT AN AQUARIUM."  All of the tourists took the hint and walked away disappointed and disgusted not getting to see what once used to be.  Seattle in general has gone to hell over recent years with homeless,  drug abusing, urine smelling, graffiti filled streets.  This will be my last visit to the area.

review.name: Loved this place!
review.reviewBody: Chip was very knowledgeable. We truly enjoyed this. I thought the price was great and the food phenomenal. I really enjoyed the tour and can’t wait to return to Seattle again.

review.name: Food tasting tour
review.reviewBody: I had a hard time finding the tour guide.  I felt tour was rushed.I did enjoy all the different food tasting. All in all a good experience.

review.name: Come HUNGRY
review.reviewBody: You want to come HUNGRY! This is an amazing food tour that will fill you up. So many samples and history. Very much recommended.

review.name: Bob made this your great.
review.reviewBody:
We were fortunate enough to have Bob as our tour guide.  Bob was EXTREMELY accommodating and came prepared with extra umbrellas and sanitizer, and a ton of knowledge.  Bob seems to know everybody at the market and he is so friendly and helpful. He’s very good at talking up the vendors on our tour since he knows so much about them.  Bob must be this company’s MVP tour guide or something. 
If I were to compare our tour to other Seattle food tours, I would say this one seemed to focus way more on the vendors than on the market as a whole. At times I felt it was like an ad for the tour vendors, which I understand is a difficult thing to balance since you need to nurture your partnership with them. There is so much rich history that was covered in this tour, but there was also a lot more that could have been covered if there was less time spent on promoting the vendors. I like learning about the vendors’ histories and products, but I don’t want to be sold to either. Learning about them already makes us want to support them by buying something. 
Suggestions for improvement:
1. It would be great if we had wireless earpieces to hear what Bob was saying. With all the ambient noise at the market, it was often difficult to make out what he was saying from the back of the group. Other tours have these and it’s a life saver. 
2. Maybe show more parts of the market, take us through some of the lower levels if possible, maybe mention how the “original” Starbucks isn’t really the original one, or explain how the busker program works at the market with the designated performance spots.

review.name: Yummy fun experience
review.reviewBody:
Bob was awesome!
We have been to market multiple times. This was first tour. Well worth taking time to do food tour! Learned some history ate good food.

review.name: Perfect Pike Market Experience
review.reviewBody: Bob was great!! Loved the tour and learning the history of the market. Perfect amount of food along the way. Gave me a layout of the market. Highly recommend!!

review.name: Do this tour instead of doing Pile Place on your own
review.reviewBody: Bob was an outstanding tour guide. We got so much more out of our visit to Pike Place with the history and insights he gave. Highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Crowded Market caused some issues
review.reviewBody: The crowd at the market made it difficult to hear. The tour was late starting and the guide seemed distracted. The parts of the history that we heard were very interesting.

review.name: Great tour!
review.reviewBody: Bob led a great tour for our family! We saw so much more of Pikes than if we had tried to go on our own. Our family - nine year old included - had a great afternoon!

name: Seattle's Original Guided Harbor Cruise
description: During this 1-hour cruise around Elliott Bay, experience all the beauty and history Seattle has to offer. With live narration from a local guide, learn about Seattle’s historic waterfront and get an up-close look at one of the west coast's largest shipping terminals. Take in the view of the city’s skyline with a spectacular panoramic background of the Cascade and Olympic mountain ranges, including majestic Mount Rainier. Enhance your experience with our curated selection of local snacks and signature beverages available for purchase onboard.

review.name: A must do cruise!
review.reviewBody: Amazing cruise,  gorgeous views!! Tour guide was very knowledgeable and entertaining . It's a must see!! Highly recommend it!

review.name: Amazing
review.reviewBody: Amazing , clear sunny day, so much history and information. Great views the crew were amazing. It was great to see everthing from an ocean view.

review.name: Great staff & amazing views!
review.reviewBody: Great short hour tour of the downtown & harbor island. Staff was friendly and loved to hear about the town history. Views were amazing! Found out that the boat captain has been working there 50 years!! Perfect beautiful day! Just enough time to see everything!

review.name: Ideal use of time for a short visit to Seattle
review.reviewBody:
This is an ideal trip and particular for short stays in Seattle, allowing you to take in a lot, in a short amount of time. 

Would I get the first boarding skip the line ticket again…absolutely no need in off-season as viewing positions are plentiful and 15% off at the bar was no huge incentive for a 1 hr trip. 

Sean who was telling us about the sights was excellent, super knowledgable and delivered at the right velocity.  Make you sure tip him at the end for his troubles, he earns it. 

Even at 13 degrees, it wasn’t  too cool in the harbour on the top deck with a coat on and the views are great. Bring your binoculars if you want to see the sea lions though!

review.name: I would recommend this cruise.
review.reviewBody: Nice cruise. Speaker was very well spoken and gave fun facts about a lot of the sights along the way. Hot chocolate was yummy and a nice touch to have available for purchase as it was a little chilly out. Fun experience in a nice environment. I would do this again.
