review.name: Enjoyable way to enjoy the Bay with wonderful downtown views
review.reviewBody: A good way to get a view of Elliott Bay, downtown Seattle, and some surrounding areas from the water.  Boarding went well; announcer/tour guide was good; and ship has lots of options for those that want to be outside and inside.  Downside was that you could hardly hear the tour guide when inside.  On a cold/windy day highly recommend good dress if you want to be outside--it can get breezy and cold.  The tour could be 1-1/2 hours (but this is not really a downside, must something I think would fit).

review.name: Satisfying in Seattle
review.reviewBody: Elijah was our tour narrator and he did a fantastic job. Smooth sailing, clean ship, cold lager, beautiful day - couldn’t have been better

review.name: Great start to a trip to Seattle!
review.reviewBody: Very informative tour of Elliott Bay and the Seattle Waterfront.  Great way to start a trip in Seattle!  The sunny day was a bonus!

review.name: Good experience.
review.reviewBody: The live guide did a great job. Everything went smoothly.  The app tells me I have to use more words,  sorry for this so here we go  :-)

review.name: Seattle dans toute sa splendeur.
review.reviewBody:
Nous avions réservé via internet et choisi la deuxième formule : accès prioritaire et choix des places.(+/- 25 à 30 dollars en plus).
Accueil très chaleureux, personnel attentif aux personnes à mobilité réduite.
Toilettes très propres.
Un joli bar, boissons à un prix correct ( accès prioritaire qui vous donne droit à une réduction de 15% sur boissons et nourriture.
Très jolie vue de Seattle.
Les phoques étaient de la partie!!!!
Aucun regret!!!!

itemListElement.name: Seattle Locks Cruise - Roundtrip Tour With Return Bus

name: Seattle Locks Cruise - Roundtrip Tour With Return Bus
description:
The Locks with Return Bus option includes the Lock Tour PLUS shuttle service back to the original departure location, making a round trip tour. 

The cruise portion starts & ends at 2 different central Seattle locations. Choose to depart Elliott Bay/Pier 54 or South Lake Union/AGC Marina. 

Enjoy a narrated cruise over Lake Union, Ballard Locks, Puget Sound & Elliott Bay. Lake Union is home to the famous floating home community seen in the classic Sleepless in Seattle. The lake is an active airport for seaplanes, water sports & the fishing industry. You'll pass many commercial docks (home to vessels from the show Deadliest Catch). On your way from the freshwater of Lake Union to the saltwater of the Puget Sound, you pass through the Ballard Locks which holds the saltwater out of the lakes. In Puget Sound, enjoy astonishing vistas of Seattle's unique skyline, Mt. Rainier and ferry boats plying the waters. 

After the Locks Tour, board a coach shuttle back. Transfer only/No narration.

review.name: Seattle…getting to know you!
review.reviewBody:
Worth every single penny! 
Hesper, the tour guide, had the most incredible knowledge of everything on the route that we took. 
Only issue was the booking was misleading as in location start as I selected bud transfer back to the pier when in fact pick up was at lake Union so we had to get an Uber to there. Make sure you check your start location.

review.name: Amazing experience
review.reviewBody: I’m so glad we decided to do this. It was amazing. The views of downtown are beautiful! The crew were very nice. I learned some history of Seattle.

review.name: Very disappointed with the returning bus service.
review.reviewBody:
Tour was great, but the returning bus did not have air conditioner on a very hot day.
Very disappointed with the bus service, please look into this. We were two senior couples and one of them was feeling sick inside the bus.

review.name: Best two hours of our visit to Seattle!
review.reviewBody:
We knew we wanted to go out on the water to get a different view of Seattle, so we chose this tour.  Our tour guide/host/deck hand, Ryan, was more than we could have asked for!  He was a wealth of knowledge, interesting stories and history and possibly the most enthusiastic resident and Ambassador for Seattle.  The captain was very good as well and they worked as a great team.  I think her name was Amy.  
The only downside was that the ship takes you to the Riverfront park, then puts you on a bus to take you back to Lake Union.  Our bus was a hop on hop off bus and the air conditioning wasn't working and it was VERY hot.  We decided to get off and take an Uber back to our place instead.  The experience was so good on the boat that it offset the return trip so there is no reason to downgrade the rating.

review.name: Great boat tour of Seattle and Locks
review.reviewBody:
This is a fun boat tour, meeting at Lake Union and traveling through the locks into the Puget Sound and finishing in Elliot Bay.  The crew was excellent, very helpful and knowledgeable.  Lars was a standout for his knowledge of history, restaurant recommendations, places to visit, local trivia.  

The highlight is actually going through the locks.  We were lucky and didn’t have to wait so we moved through pretty quickly.  From the boat  you’ll see the floating houses, including the one from Sleepless in Seattle, lighthouses, islands, giant cruise ships, dolphins, and a great view of the Seattle skyline. 

The boat is clean and spacious with a good variety of food and beverage offerings.  There’s an option to take the bus back to Lake Union, in our case a fun double decker bus.

Our passengers included young children, elderly grandparents and everyone in between.  So appropriate for all ages. 

I highly recommend this tour

review.name: What a great experience!
review.reviewBody: What a great time we had!!  Beautiful and interesting views of the Sound and the Seattle Harbor.  Really really enjoyed it!

review.name: Amazing sights of Seattle locks
review.reviewBody: Lovely tour out through the Peugeot sound and then through the lock.  Could not have had more perfect weather.  The tour guide did an amazing job explaining what we were seeing and some of the history of Seattle.  Would recommend to anyone considering this tour.

review.name: Argosy Locks Harbor Tour
review.reviewBody: Vince, the attendant checking us started our trip wonderfully. He is friendly, helpful, and efficient. Then, Jackson, gave us a wonderfully detailed tour on board. Thank you Argosy for a very nice tour.

review.name: Dropping At The Locks
review.reviewBody: The ride was awesome. Kiki was very knowledgeable and did an outstanding job of informing us about the sites and tour. My favorite part was probably the locks and watching how far down we dropped (about 16ft ) which was pretty impressive. Would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Seattle.

review.name: Take the bout ride but don't waste your money on the bus
review.reviewBody: I gave them 5 Stars because  the bout was great beautiful views knowledgeable tour guide reasonably priced on board for drinks very friendly and good crew over all it was a great experience. However once we got off the boat the experience was night and  day we paid extra for the return bus do not waste your money  find a different way  to your car they took forever to come no one new which bus we were suppose to get on or when it was coming. once we got one the bus the tour is a pre-recording that play on a loop and speaking of loops we went around and around downtown for over an hour at one point being within  a block of our car and then turning away from it I was truly beginning to thinkI would   not get back to my car long story short  take the bout ride but don't waste your money on the bus

itemListElement.name: Boeing Factory Tour with Private Group Transport from Seattle

name: Boeing Factory Tour with Private Group Transport from Seattle
description: Take a trip to the Boeing Factory with your group of up to 7 people (contact us if you are interested in larger groups) in your own private car with your expert guide to give you interesting insight into the history of Boeing and Seattle on your way. Once you arrive, get a behind-the-scenes look at how Boeing airplanes are made on this tour of the Boeing factory in Everett, Washington. On an 80 minute extensive tour of the facilities with an expert guide, explore full-sized jet engine exhibits to see massive aircraft including the 777 and revolutionary 787 Dreamliner being assembled. In the Future of Flight Aviation Center, enjoy an exhilarating virtual flying experience and design your own airplane!  Private transport from anywhere in the greater Seattle area is included.

review.name: Customized Tours Seattle
review.reviewBody: The tour company Customized Tours Seattle were easy and great to deal with, our Driver/Guide Mark was brilliant, that said the Boeing Factory tour itself was out of their hands and leave a lot to be desired, not much happening at the 747 Factory, 777 was better but overall not worth the money for the tour itself

review.name: An eye opening experience but no picture taking allowed inside the plant
review.reviewBody:
This is a must see tour.  They picked me up at the hotel, drove us over to the Boeing plant, visited the museum while waiting for our tour to start.  Our tour guide was very good, but the group was so large that sometimes we could not hear what he had to say. 
Once the tour started inside the plant we were advised we were not allowed to take any pictures.
The plant is immense but we went on a Saturday so many of the workers were off.
At the end of plant tour they drop you off at the gift shop for souvenirs.
Our driver took us back to our hotels and along the way gave us informative information about Seattle.

review.name: Exciting
review.reviewBody: I have wanted to do this tour for years and now I have. We were picked up from our hotel in Seattle and driven to Everett by a friendly driver. When we arrived at the factory we had time to look around the shops and other exhibits prior to our booked tour time. Our guide was an ex airline pilot so hid knowledge and experience showed in his presentation, we were taken by bus to the factory where a lot of the areas of manufacture of aircraft was explained to us. After our tour of the factory more time was available to browse the shops or go to the observation deck to watch planes take off and see the aircraft that were ready for trials. Altogether a great tour.

review.name: Boeing tour with ‘Elvis’
review.reviewBody:
I booked a tour to the Boeing factory through Viator for myself my Mum and son and had a fabulous trip.
Our guide Dave, who is Seattle’s Elvis was really informative and interesting, he made our trip so relaxed and was very engaging.

The factory itself is ‘awesome’ and was a real eye opener.

Dave didn’t rush us and then dropped us back in Seattle at a location of our choice.

If you fancy seeing how the big birds are made then I would recommend this tour and if you’re as fortunate as us you’ll also get Dave to take you there and back.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Private Grand City Highlights Tour

name: Seattle Private Grand City Highlights Tour
description: Get up close and personal to the Emerald City on this private sightseeing tour of Seattle’s highlights. On this personalized tour, decide between must-see attractions including Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square and the Ballard Locks, as well as Chinatown and other diverse neighborhoods that give Seattle its character. Choose from popping into local art galleries, grabbing coffee from the original Starbucks, browsing the vendors at Pike Place, or soaking up sweeping views of Puget Sound, Mt Rainier and the Olympic Mountains from the iconic Space Needle (admission not included). Your private guide will provide commentary on the sights while showing you the best places for food, shopping and entertainment. By the end of the tour, you’ll know Seattle like a local!

review.name: Mark is a great driver and tour guide.
review.reviewBody:
May 20th 2021

This is our second tour in a few years. When we make it back we love to get on a tour, last time, or a private tour this time. Mark was our driver both times. He’s an awesome tour guide and will work it out if you want to spend more or less time at a certain location.

review.name: City sites
review.reviewBody: This tour was totally different from the tour we took previous day. This was more of a tour of the city of Seattle.

review.name: OH MY GOD!!
review.reviewBody: OUTSTANDING...service, food and experience!!  SO well liked, reservations are a Must! HIGHLY Recommend!!

itemListElement.name: Private Mt Rainier National Park Day Trip from Seattle

name: Private Mt Rainier National Park Day Trip from Seattle
description: Escape the hustle and bustle of Seattle and enjoy a day of breathtaking scenery at Mt Rainier National Park. On this private Mt Rainier tour, take a scenic drive through the old-growth evergreen forests of America's fifth-oldest national park, affording views of sparkling lakes, flower meadows, massive glaciers and sweeping alpine vistas. Visit Narada Falls, Reflection Lake and Inspiration point, and stop along the way to view wildlife and take photos. Learn about the park's history at the Paradise Jackson Visitor Center and Longmire Visitor Center and Museum, and bring a picnic lunch to enjoy amidst the scenery.

review.name: Mt Ranier Private Tour
review.reviewBody: The your guide, Jasper,  was amazing. As an environmental science major with experience to boot,  his knowlefge of the terrain, trees, climate, etc. of Mt.Ranier National Park was off the charts.

review.name: Great way to see Mount Rainier
review.reviewBody: The wildflowers at the Paradise visitors center trails were spectacular!  We had beautiful sunny (hot) weather and were able to hike in shorts and see multiple waterfalls and had amazing views.  Mark was our tour guide and was very friendly and cheerfully took photos of us along the way.  He also helped us to spot wildlife including jays and marmots.  He escorted us to a grocery store to pick up a picnic on the way up so we did not have to think about food later on which was very helpful.  He had a big enough bus that everyone could spread  out and there was space for all our luggage so it was a very streamlined way to transition from cruise ship to airport later on.

review.name: Great tour!
review.reviewBody: Very accommodating, safe driving, friendly guide. Would recommend for families with older children! Beautiful views

review.name: Great!
review.reviewBody: Our guide Joe was fantastic!  We all earned our cupcakes and survived to the end!  Joe knew all the great spots for photos and wildlife.  We were lucky the wheater was the best all week

review.name: Fantastic tour
review.reviewBody: We had tour with Mark who was very entertaining and informative. We hit all the spots that we were able to get to in the park. Place was breathtaking. Weather was amazing and we were able to see whole mountain without any cloud covers. Truly unforgettable experience

review.name: Joe was awesome
review.reviewBody:
We got onto the bus and Joe, the driver, informed us that Paradise was closed due to road closures. Joe took us The Northwest Trek. I was prepared to be disappointed but was not. We then ventured into Mt Rainier where we were given a tour of the park ranger areas and an amazing hike. 

There were 5 people on our tour and everyone was treated list a special guests. Joe answered a million questions, kept us entertained, knew when to dim the lights and kept us in the know of where we were going and what to expect. 

He stopped a grocery store for snacks along the way. He bought a round of cupcakes for everyone too. 

I will do this tour again the next time I am in Seattle in hopes that we will make it to paradise.

itemListElement.name: Private Snoqualmie Falls & Woodinville Wine Day Tour from Seattle

name: Private Snoqualmie Falls & Woodinville Wine Day Tour from Seattle
description: Enjoy a day full of wine tasting and amazing Northwest scenery on this private tour from Seattle. Washington has emerged as one of the top wine-producing regions in the US, and on this tour you’ll get to wine taste at two or more of Woodinville’s award-winning wineries, including beloved Chateau Ste Michelle Winery. Then, travel through the rolling foothills of the Cascade Mountains to spectacular Snoqualmie Falls. Sample chocolate treats in Issaquah before traveling across Lake Washington on one of the longest floating bridges in the world.

review.name: Wine Tour and Snoqualmie Falls
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide Joel was very knowledgeable about all aspects of the areas we traveled. He was kind, helpful, and gave us great suggestions for activities to keep us busy the rest of our trip!!!! We followed up and went to other places he suggested, and we’re not disappointed!!!!The wineries were great with top notch service, but by far the Snoqualmie Falls walk was the best!!! Absolutely breathtaking!!!

review.name: Fun Filled Day
review.reviewBody: Cory was a great tour guide through the entire day. We visited 2 great wineries, the falls were spectacular and we wrapped at the chocolate factory! Goose Ridge was a small boutique winery and the staff was very personable and friendly. I would recommend this tour to anyone!

review.name: Amazing Day Trip
review.reviewBody: We’d like to thank Cory for being an amazing guide. Very knowledgeable and very friendly. The wines tasted great and the falls was SPECTACULAR!!! If you’re looking for a hassle free and great experience this is one to choose, hands down!

review.name: A fun day with wine.chocolate and the falls!
review.reviewBody:
We had a wonderful day trip! Our tour guide, Cory made the trip. As he picked us up he took the time to introduce us. His sense of humor put the group at ease and soon it felt like friends not just a bunch of people thrown together.  He knew the guides at each of the stops which again made us comfortable and welcomed.

Cory gave us tips on how to get the most out of our time. He gave us a great deal of information on the areas that we drove through and visited.

This was my favorite of the tours i took on this trip.  Barbara A

review.name: Fun day trip to Snoqualmie Falls and Winery Tour!!
review.reviewBody: Cory is a fantastic tour guide! Besides being a great conversationalist who was very knowledable of local history, he was also a great driver. Cory's anecdotes and history lessons made the trip really interesting and entertaining. This added to the already exciting and fun times that we experienced at the wineries as well as the Snoqualmie Falls. The stop at the Boehm's Candy factory just made the day complete. Thanks to Cory and a fun group, we have a simply wonderful time!

review.name: Love the long Trip
review.reviewBody:
They pick you up from the Hotel on time, the Tour Person/Driver explains everything in detail and it was very professional, I loved the presentation and the time we spent at the Goose Ridge Vineyard, I learned a lot about Vines and the 2 presenters were excellent on their presentation.
The water falls was spectacular!

review.name: Tour
review.reviewBody: Would highly recommend this tour. The stops at the two wineries were both entertaining & informative. Lunch was great. The stop at the Falls was beautiful, followed up by the Yum-mmmeee stop at the Bohem Chocolate Factory. Our guide Cory was the best. Loved every minute!

review.name: A Vacation for Seattle Residents - Great way to chill !
review.reviewBody: I've lived in Downtown Seattle with my husband for 15 years . It was just a great idea to hop on a bus for a Saturday 6 hour  wine and Snoqualmie Falls  and Boehms Chocolate tour.  Cory (our guide) pointed out every building, land masses and waters of importance. A walking and factual memory of details. A funny and lighthearted guy.  We loved our day..had our wine and then stayed home to chill.. A wonderful escape from the city even though we had been to many of the places already.  Highly recommend this trip and ask for Cory !!  Michael Greer M.D.

itemListElement.name: Mt. Rainier National Park Day Tour from Seattle

name: Mt. Rainier National Park Day Tour from Seattle
description: On this full-day tour of Washington State’s Mt Rainier, you’ll visit the majestic 14,411-foot (4,392-m) volcano and learn about the area from your informative guide. You’ll also explore local treasures like lakes, old growth forest and waterfalls en-route from Seattle to Mt Rainier. Nature lovers won’t want to miss this! In winter and spring snowshoeing and sledding are included at no extra charge. Hiking will be offered as well PLEASE WEAR appropriate clothes and shoes. Our company picks up at hotels and spends more time in the park than others. a photographers paradise.

review.name: Great experience
review.reviewBody:
Excellent trip up to Mount Rainier park. Our guide Cory was very knowledgeable, friendly and fun. There is some flexibility to what is done on the day due to the weather, time of year and also abilities in the group. There was a good mix of driving to scenic spots but also the chance to do some more challenging hikes for those that wanted it. Would recommend to anyone wanting to explore Mount Rainier.

Make sure you bring good boots if you want to do the snowy hikes!

review.name: Great day trip to Mt. Ranier! Highly recommend!
review.reviewBody: My daughter and I booked this trip and we weren’t disappointed! We were promptly picked up at our hotel and proceeded to pick up other passengers.  We had plenty of stops along the way and definitely a lot of picture opportunities! Our tour guide Cory was great and informative without talking too much..it was the right amount for our trip. We highly recommend booking this tour!

review.name: Nice tour guide Mr Chris
review.reviewBody: Today, I went on a trip to Mount Rainier with my tour guide Chris. Along the way, he took us to many scenic spots, such as Longmire, Paradise ,etc. Tour guide Chris gave us enthusiastic introductions in a vivid way. He was very friendly and professional.

review.name: The park is gorgeous! We couldn't really see the top, due to its local weather, but saw a lot of beautiful scenery. We even got
review.reviewBody:
Even though our hotel wasn't one of the pre-planned pickup sites, this company worked with us to get us from our hotel.

We requested this (regardless that we'd only have had to walk a couple of blocks to get picked up). We needed help because my husband walks with a cane, and walking can sometimes be a challenge. In addition to that, as we were leaving the Space Needle (the evening before our tour, he slipped and fell on the wet pavement outside!).

The person who did our booking was so nice and helpful. She arranged for us to be picked up and dropped off back at our hotel.
The driver was a great guide and so helpful, too.

review.name: This was a fun time
review.reviewBody: This was a fun day.  We had a great time.  We liked that it was a small group.  We had perfect weather and went snowshoeing which we had never done.  It was a good time.

review.name: Great Day Tour for a Casual Visit to Mt Rainier
review.reviewBody:
I went on this day tour to Mt Rainier and our tour guide was Cory. The tour looks to be subbed out to a company called Customized Tours. Overall, this is a good tour and I recommend it. I am stretched for time on this particular trip to the USA, so this day trip worked well for me on this occasion, but I think if I was going to visit Mt Rainier again, I'd rent a car and go it alone, simply so as to have flexibility to do things at my own pace. However, this tour does pack plenty into the day and is about right in terms of value for money. 

The only negative is that just after I was picked up and before we'd even got going, our guide said that he could be tipped via various mechanisms, and there was even a sign at the front of the bus saying tips are expected for good service and so-on. I've been visiting the USA my whole life, and in the last few years there's been an unsightly move to tips being expected, not appreciated as a bonus, and the entitlement is not warranted. I always tip for extra special service - and did tip Cory - but if the customer chooses not to, that's a customer choice, they should not be made to feel they must or are somehow out of line. So the tour drops a star for this, although in fairness, it should be just a half star dropped as it's not the end of the world, but it's not possible to do this. 

The tour itself is superb and I really enjoyed it. Cory was a great guide and made sure we had adequate stops in and out of Mt Rainier. At the location itself, he was incredibly clear on timings, where to meet, where things are, dos and don'ts, also talked about the history of the site. You can of course read all that there, but having an engaging guide like Cory really brings this to life, so is part of the value-add of doing a tour like this. 

I would say this tour is better suited to someone like me, a casual tourist on a tight timescale, I think if you want a proper hiking tour then you'll need something different, this is really a high-level view of the main points about Mt Rainier, which is fine for me as I am disabled and can't walk too far anyway, but any serious hikers might feel frustrated. 

Mt Rainier is spectacular in winter, truly a beautiful place to wander enjoying the peace and the sights. I recommend water repellant walking boots in winter, as the snow can be deep (I feel in up to my thighs) and no one wants soggy feet al day long!

So, 5/5 for the guide and tour, but the overt tipping mentions are not needed, people will tip for good service, as I did. But it's not just these guys, in my last few trips to the USA, since around 2022, there's been an unsightly focus on expecting and extracting tips and my new policy is if someone asks for one, then on principle I won't give one!

review.name: Transportation to Mt Rainier. Limited
review.reviewBody:
The mountain was beautiful.  Although cloudy we were able to snowshoe and hike in different spots.   However, I wouldnt consider this a tour - more transportation.   the group was dropped at Mt Rainier lodge, given snowshoes (for those who wanted),  told to download a trail app and meet back at the van 2 hours later.  Considering I was solo on this trip this limited my exploration.   I was uneasy about going off on my own (turned around a couple times on the trail knowing that if something happened or I got lost I would be in a bind).    
Although the driver did mention some facts of the area driving up to the mountain he didnt explain the itinerary until he was ready to (usually right before dropping us off at a stop).   At least an hour of the day was spent at two stores for riders to get snacks/coffee.   There were some other things that were off putting but I will not list here since overall I don’t recommend. 
I previously used another tour company in Seattle and although a little more money, the experience was top notch (plan discussed, tour guide on all hikes and lunch provided).  Will use the other company the next time I’m in Seattle.

review.name: Must do activity when in Seattle
review.reviewBody: BOOK IT! Thank you Lucas for making this experience an even better one with your expertise and knowledge. Such a great experience. Would definitely recommend

review.name: Awesome tour
review.reviewBody: Lucas was great from the beginning to the end of the tour. He was informative but didn't overload us with dull facts. He was also very flexible about the areas we visited in the park. I would gladly do it again!

review.name: Life Changing Experience!- Thanks Lucas :)
review.reviewBody:
If you are on the fence about this tour, go ahead and buy your ticket….TODAY! 

I had such an amazing time even by myself! Our tour started with a hotel pickup and then to Kroger. Our tour guide, Lucas (?) let us stop there to grab any last minute items we may need. I suggest wearing warm layers. I had fleece lined yoga pants along with thick socks, 2 layers of shirts, water-proof hiking boots and gloves. 

I would also suggest brining snacks and a lunch wi the you if you don’t plan on buying anything at the grocery store. There is a Starbucks there if you’re not a morning person and want to grab coffee. 

Our drive up to the mountain was not bad at all. Lucas talked to us the whole way up, giving us amazing fun facts and funny stories about his time as a tour guide. You will stop at a clearing by a tiny church to get your first clear view of Rainier. There is a photo opportunity here as well! 

The best part of the hike was the waterfall and Paradise Lakes! If you have the option to choose between Paradise Lakes and another stop PLEASE choose the lakes. The view of the mountain is absolutely glorious. I cried. UGLY tears. I’ve never experienced something so beautiful in my life. 

More tips: 
• Bring a GOOD portable charger. You’re going to take lots of pictures and videos!
• Bring snacks or buy them at the Kroger or little store you stop at on the way back to Seattle

itemListElement.name: Woodinville Wine and Snoqualmie Falls Day Tour

name: Woodinville Wine and Snoqualmie Falls Day Tour
description: On our loop tour east of Seattle you will see incredible views and taste wines at small family owned, estate-boutique wineries for an intimate tasting experience. You will have the opportunity to sample wines at two wine establishments occasionally including Goose Ridge and the famous Chateau Ste. Michelle winery or Woodinville Whiskey Company (if Chateau is closed). This sightseeing excursion will lead you deep into the rolling Cascade foothills, past lush horse ranches and flower farms, through scenic single lane rural roads leading you up to one of the top visited natural attractions within the state of Washington, 268 foot Snoqualmie Falls underneath towering Mount Si. Should time allow you may also receive a BONUS stop for a sweet treat!

review.name: Wine, Snoqualmie Falls, Chocolate
review.reviewBody: This was a lovely fun day of wine tasting, visiting Snoqualmie Falls and touring a chocolate factory. We visited three wineries: two were dedicated tastings and one was a lunch stop. Our driver, Mark, was fun and knowledgable and was a safe driver. We had a great day and highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Fabulous day!
review.reviewBody: The trip was fantastic! Mark was absolutely phenomenal as both a driver and tour guide. He was knowledgeable about the areas we travelled to, the wineries and was full of fun facts. All three wineries were great! Would highly recommend this tour..request Mark!

review.name: Great hop- on hop-off small bus trip.
review.reviewBody:
Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls Tour was delightful. While Chateau Ste. Michelle was larger with an open air building concept,  Goose Neck Estate was comfortable, warm, and cozy. Goose Neck was our favorite of the two. Chris at Goose Neck was very knowledgeable and down to earth.
Our tour guide, Mark, was prompt, pleasant, knowledgeable, and comical.
Would recommend, but be mindful of “fees” and additional costs of impromptu purchases.

review.name: Wonderful tour!
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide Mark was wonderful. He was very knowledgeable of the area and history. Kept things fun and lighthearted. The wineries were wonderful. Loved Chateau St Michelle! Lunch was delicious. The falls were spectacular, worth the visit. Loved Boehms Chocolate factory.  Well worth the money to have someone knowledgeable drive you around.

review.name: Winery & Waterfall
review.reviewBody: Mark, with Customized Tours was absolutely Fantastic at his job!! He made the tour, lots of fun!! He showed us extra sights- was very knowledgeable about the area & he was so entertaining!!! Highly recommend Mark!! My daughter and I said this was the best day of our trip tp Seattle!!

review.name: Top Tour
review.reviewBody: This is a fabulous day in the wine country outside Seattle. We spent the entire day visiting the falls and several wineries. Tasting an and lunch was included. Our guide made sure we were introduced to the history and geography and culture of the area. Highly recommend!

review.name: Recommended
review.reviewBody:
Fun day! Unlike some tours where you spend long hours driving to spend only a few hours at the intended destination, this trip was diverse, with multiple places along the way and enough time to enjoy. 

Mark was extremely fun and made sure we were all taken care of.

review.name: Friends on vacation
review.reviewBody: Disappointed in trip.  Went to only 2 wineries.  The first was in a strip mall, the second was Chateau St. Michelle.  The first was personable although expected to be at an actual winery.  The second is a huge establishment and not so personable.  Thought there would be a third visit to a winery.  Our driver asked if we would be interested in going to a family-owned chocolate factory.  All said yes.  Thought this might be in addition to a 3rd wine stop.  It was the last stop of the day.  The falls were lovely.  Overall, disappointed.

review.name: Excellent Tour
review.reviewBody: James was excellent as our tour guide, gave us lots of information and made this tour great for us visiting Auzzies. Would highly recommend,  saw lots of beautiful countryside , tasted some lovely wine and chocolate

review.name: Great tour.  Had a blast.
review.reviewBody: We had a really good time.  The Goose Ridge winery tasting was exceptional.  Very intimate and accommodating setting and service.  I had never heard of this winery/wine.  Will definitely be drinking more of their wine.  Had some shipped home.  And the cider was awesome too - lavender!  The water fall was beautiful.  Lunch at the other winery was very good - had the flat bread and wine flight.  Of course the chocolate shop was yummy. I highly recommend this tour.  Our driver, Cory, was outstanding.  He gave us lots of fun and insightful information  along the way.
